intro: Davya claussenii, commonly known as the mountain davya, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and plant enthusiasts.
